description.content:
Only supported in Canada and USA right now.
Use this API to start the phone number ordering flow. See the example in the description of the voice admin API to get a view of the full flow.

To use this API, the authenticated user must be an [admin](https://support.goto.com/connect/help/how-do-i-give-a-user-and-user-group-admin-permissions) 
or [super admin](https://support.goto.com/connect/help/how-do-i-give-a-user-user-group-super-admin-permissions-gotoconnect-give-super-admin-permissions).

### Authentication Scopes

`voice-admin.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

response.name: The order was created. You can use the ID in the body to get detail about the order.

The request has one or more issues. Potential error codes are

* `INVALID_ACCOUNT_KEY` - The account key is invalid or unknown

* `INVALID_AREA_CODE` - The given area code is invalid

There was an error during authentication.  The API returns a number of `errorCode` values in
the response that provide additional details.

* `AUTHN_INVALID_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is not valid.
* `AUTHN_EXPIRED_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is expired.
* `AUTHN_MALFORMED_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is malformed.
* `AUTHN_UNSUPPORTED_SCHEME` - The supplied authentication scheme is unsupported.

There was an error during authorization.  The API returns a number of `errorCode` values in the response that provide additional details.
* `AUTHZ_INSUFFICIENT_SCOPE` - The supplied token lacks sufficient scopes to perform the
  requested action on the requested resource type or the request supplied no token.
  Enforcement of scopes occurs before other authorization decisions and is based solely on the
  resource type and requested action. This response provides no indication of the existance
  of the specific resource targeted by the request.
Your request was denied because you have reached some request limit for this API. Try again later.

An unknown error occurred. The API returns a number of `errorCode` values in the response that provide additional details.
* `UNKNOWN_ERROR` - An unknown error occurred.

description.content:
Obtains a paginated list of phone numbers in an account.

### Authentication Scopes

`voice-admin.v1.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

query.description: This is the key of the account (organization). The [Admin API](/admin#tag/Me) can be used to find account keys.

The opaque identifier representing a valid marker for the desired page. The returned `nextPageMarker` from a paginated collection is normally used here to fetch the next page. Default to first page when not provided.
The maximum number of items returned in a page.

response.name:
List of phone numbers. Will return an empty list if the user doesn't have the permission for the given account
or the given account is not found.

The request has one or more issues. The API returns a number of
`constraintViolation`s in the response that provide additional
details for the following cases:

* The `pageMarker` or `pageSize` is invalid
* `accountKey` is missing

There was an error during authentication.  The API returns a number of `errorCode` values in
the response that provide additional details.

* `AUTHN_INVALID_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is not valid.
* `AUTHN_EXPIRED_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is expired.
* `AUTHN_MALFORMED_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is malformed.
* `AUTHN_UNSUPPORTED_SCHEME` - The supplied authentication scheme is unsupported.

* `AUTHZ_INSUFFICIENT_SCOPE` - The scopes granted to the supplied token are insufficient to perform the requested action or the request supplied no token.
 
* `UNAUTHORIZED` - The principal represented by the supplied token is not authorized to perform the specified action on the targeted resource and has the ability to read (GET) the targeted resource.
Your request was denied because you have reached some request limit for this API. Try again later.

description.content:
Add permissions to a user for the given phone number. 
For instance, if you want to enable texting for a user, you can provide the the following payload:

```
{
  "userKey": "123456", 
  "permissions": ["TEXTING"]
}
```

To use this API, the authenticated user must be an [admin](https://support.goto.com/connect/help/how-do-i-give-a-user-and-user-group-admin-permissions) 
or [super admin](https://support.goto.com/connect/help/how-do-i-give-a-user-user-group-super-admin-permissions-gotoconnect-give-super-admin-permissions).

### Authentication Scopes

`voice-admin.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

description.content:
Delete a specific extension by `extensionId`.
Delete extensions at your own risk. For instance, if there are some voicemails associated to the extension,  the voicemails will be lost. If the extension is part of a dial plan, redirected phone number or any other  association, the associated objects will need to be updated. This also allows the deletion of dial plans,  ring groups, virtual fax, shared voicemail and conference bridges which cannot be recovered.
### Authentication Scopes
`voice-admin.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

description.content:
Only pass the fields that you want to update.
Only direct extensions (lines) are supported for update at this time.
If you want to set the number for a given extension, you can use the following body:

```
{
  "number": "1234"
}
```

If you want to set the name, you can use:

```
{
  "name": "Software Engineering"
}
```

You are also able to update the following properties in batch or individually

```
{
  "omitFromDirectories": true,
  "omitFromAutoAttendants": true,
  "sharedAppearance": false
}
```

If you want to assign a user primary extension:

```
{
  "assignedPrimaryUserKey": "3141631416"
}
```

NOTE: There can be only one primary extension per user.
Hence, if you try to assign a primary extension to a user that already has one, you will get an HTTP 409 response such as follows:
```
  {"errorCode":"USER_ALREADY_HAS_PRIMARY_EXTENSION","message":"Given user key [3141631416] on account [1956177422157042821], already assigned to extension [12ed21de-9be4-4ca7-85d2-0f2356cacc83]","reference":"713e0461-22a8-4892-885a-f2d0bea4475a"}
```

To proceed with this modification, you need to unassign the primary extension of this user first, by sending the following request body:
```
PATCH /extensions/12ed21de-9be4-4ca7-85d2-0f2356cacc83
{
  "assignedPrimaryUserKey": null
}
```

Ensure that a primary user is set before assigning a secondary user.
When secondary users are assigned to an extension without a primary user already being set 
secondary users may be promoted to primary based on the licensing, current user extension configuration, 
and previous interactions of the secondary users.

Situations to be considered are:
* When initially setting users for an extension
* When removing a primary user from an extension
* When replacing one primary user with another

If you want to assign a user secondary extension:

```
{
  "assignedSecondaryUserKeys": ["3141631416"]
}
```

Or you could also assign it to a list of users:

```
{
  "assignedSecondaryUserKeys": ["3141631417", "3141631418"]
}
```

variable.description: (Required) The extension's unique identifier.

response.name:
The extension was patched.
The fields `assignedPrimaryUserKey` and `assignedSecondaryUserKeys` are only returned,
if they are passed in the request body.
response.body:
{
 "id": "quis dolore",
 "accountKey": "enim incididunt Lorem ut",
 "name": "amet culpa officia do c",
 "number": "dolor",
 "omitFromDirectories": false,
 "organizationId": "non sint ea incididunt",
 "type": "SHARED_VOICEMAIL",
 "omitFromAutoAttendants": false,
 "sharedAppearance": true,
 "assignedPrimaryUserKey": "occaecat officia",
 "assignedSecondaryUserKeys": [
  "dolore dolore reprehenderit",
  "aute sint voluptate mollit"
 ]
}

item.name: Update voicemail for a specific extension

request.name: Update voicemail for a specific extension

description.content:
Update voicemail settings for a specific extension.

Only pass the fields that you want to update.
If you want to set the time zone for given extension voicemail, you can use the following request body:

```
{
  "timeZone": "America/New_York"
}
```

If you want to set the voicemail password, you can use:

```
{
  "password": "9876"
}
```

If you want to enable access to an extension voicemail without a password, you can pass:

```
{
  "allowAccessWithoutPassword": true
}
```

If you want to allow callers to review their recorded messages and enable voicemail messages transcriptions:

```
{
  "allowMessageReview": true,
  "transcriptionEnabled": true
}
```

If you want callers who press 0 to be transferred to an operator extension, you can pass:

```
{
  "allowEscapeToOperator": true,
  "operatorExtensionId": "458e38ae-f468-11eb-9a03-0242ac130003"
}
```

### Authentication Scopes

`voice-admin.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

description.content:
Obtains a paginated list of devices in an account.
Note that Business Continuity and GoTo Room devices are not returned by this API right now.

To use this API, the authenticated user must be an [admin](https://support.goto.com/connect/help/how-do-i-give-a-user-and-user-group-admin-permissions) 
or [super admin](https://support.goto.com/connect/help/how-do-i-give-a-user-user-group-super-admin-permissions-gotoconnect-give-super-admin-permissions).

`voice-admin.v1.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

query.description: This is the key of the account (organization). The [Admin API](/admin#tag/Me) can be used to find account keys.

The opaque identifier representing a valid marker for the desired page. The returned `nextPageMarker` from a paginated collection is normally used here to fetch the next page. Default to first page when not provided.
The maximum number of items returned in a page.

response.name:

description.content:
Update a device. 

To use this API, the authenticated user must be an [admin](https://support.goto.com/connect/help/how-do-i-give-a-user-and-user-group-admin-permissions) 
or [super admin](https://support.goto.com/connect/help/how-do-i-give-a-user-user-group-super-admin-permissions-gotoconnect-give-super-admin-permissions).

### Authentication Scopes

`voice-admin.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

Only pass the fields that you want to update.

If you want to set the name for a given device, you can use the following body:

```
{
  "name": "John Mayer"
}
```

If you want to set the modelId, you can use:

```
{
  "modelId": "aastra.480i"
}
```

If you want to assign a user to a device, do the following:

```
{
  "assignedUserKey": "3141631416"
}
```

Note that you can't pass fields other than `assignedUserKey` when this one is provided.

If you want to set the license, you can use:

```
{
  "licenseKey": "896518965461657741"
}
```

It is important to note that licenses can only be assigned to standalone devices,
and users can only be assigned to user devices. If you try to assign a user to a
standalone device or assign a license to a user device, you will get a
`INVALID_DEVICE_TYPE` bad request error.

Also, note that you cannot assign a user or a license to a device along with other field updates. 
For example, you cannot assign a user and update the device name at the same request, or assign a user and a license at the same request.
If you try, you will get an `ASSIGNMENTS_MUST_BE_ALONE` bad request error.

Any license changes take time to propagate through the platform and may not be immediately reflected in the device.

variable.description: (Required) The device's unique identifier.

response.name: The device was updated
response.body:
{
 "id": "adipisicing sunt et nulla",
 "name": "sunt Ut",
 "modelId": "veniam ad Lorem voluptate fugiat",
 "macAddress": "esse pariatur do",
 "assignedUserKey": "ad pariatur ut irure",
 "licenseKey": "dolore eu tempor"
}

* `INVALID_USER_FOR_ACCOUNT` - The user key is not found for the given device account

description.content:
Creates a subscription for the user. The user must first create a
notification channel by using the Notification Channel API. The user
will be able to receive notifications for the voicemailbox requested after
subscribing.
Operation will be denied if the user is not the owner of the mailbox or a super admin.


The subscription allows notifications to be sent to the
notification channel with the provided notification channel ID. Notifications would be
received only if the user is the owner of the mailbox or a super admin. Only 1
subscription per voicemailbox can exist at a time for a given user's channel ID.
When a new subscription is created for a combination
of channel ID and voicemailbox ID that already has a subscription,
a 409 Conflict will be returned.

### Authentication Scopes

`voicemail.v1.notifications.manage` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

### Example request

```
curl -X POST \
  https://api.goto.com/voicemail/v1/subscriptions \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {auth-token}' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{ \
    "channelId": "cfeb8e9a-495c-4e48-b3bf-fe1b4cf1cf76", \
    "accountKey": "2930718022414574861", \
    "voicemailboxId": "606d12ff-9482-4ff0-8971-95133ffc47d1", \
    "events": [ \
      "NEW_VOICEMAIL" \
    ] \
}'
```

description.content:
To use this API, the authenticated user must be a [super admin](https://support.goto.com/connect/help/how-do-i-give-a-user-user-group-super-admin-permissions-gotoconnect-give-super-admin-permissions) or have the [configure pbx](https://support.goto.com/connect/help/what-permissions-are-available) permission.

This API will return all the users including their lines of the given account (organization).

### Authentication Scopes
`users.v1.lines.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
###### Load Users of an Account (Organization)
```
curl 'https://api.goto.com/users/v1/users?accountKey={accountKey}' -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}'
```
###### Load Next Page
The presence of the field `nextPageMarker` in the response indicates that eventually there are more users to retrieve.
```
curl 'https://api.goto.com/users/v1/users?accountKey={accountKey}&pageMarker={nextPageMarker}'\
-H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}'
```

query.description: (Required) This is the key of the account (organization). The [Admin API](/admin#tag/Me) can be used to find account keys.

description.content:
The calls resource enables you to programmatically initiate a phone call. First, the API queues the request,
a return code of 202 means that the request was successfully queued - we typically process the request within milliseconds.
Next, we process your request in two phases. First we initiate a call to the line identified by `from.lineId`. If this call is answered,
a call is then initiated to `dialString`. A common use of this API is to implement click-to-call functionality in applications by initiating
a call from a GoToConnect line to the targeted phone number.

To initiate a call on the line defined at `from.lineId`, make a request with the following body :

```json
  {
    "dialString": "(866) 768-5429",
    "from": {
      "lineId": "99be59bc-edfc-4c62-a73f-06087ec2fe00"
    }
  }
```

When the call is answered on the line defined at `from.lineId`, a new call is initiated to `(866) 768-5429`.
### Intercom
When the  "autoAnswer" boolean is set to true, the call to the line identified by the lineId will be answered automatically when possible (the Intercom feature needs to be enabled on the line and the instructions to do so are available here: https://support.goto.com/connect/help/how-do-i-intercom-a-line-or-ring-group-gotoconnect-intercom-line-ring-group).  
By default, all newly created lines should have this feature enabled.  

This feature is intended to work with a single device connected and will not work properly in some situations. 
The limitations include, but are not limited to, when a Ring Group or Call Queue is provided in the lineId. Another current limitation is when multiple devices are connected simultaneously, in which case multiple calls to the destination can be made at once. For the best user experience, this field should be used when a single device selected with the lineId exists. 

The GoTo desktop application is considered a device that will be available to answer automatically the initiated call if possible. 
### Security
The authorization to initiate a call on a specific line is determined by the provided `ACCESS_TOKEN`. Lines from the authenticated user will be available for initiating a call. 
Also, if the current user is a [super admin](https://support.goto.com/connect/help/how-do-i-give-a-user-user-group-super-admin-permissions-gotoconnect-give-super-admin-permissions)  of the organization, all lines of the organization will be available for initiating a call.  Note that if a super admin is associated to a device and a request is done on a line associated with this device, all devices associated to  this line will ring, not only the one of the super admin.

### Authentication Scopes
`calls.v2.initiate` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl -XPOST 'https://api.goto.com/calls/v2/calls'          \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}'                \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'                      \
  -d '{                                                    \
        "dialString": "(866) 768-5429",                    \
        "from": {                                          \
          "lineId": "99be59bc-edfc-4c62-a73f-06087ec2fe00" \
        }                                                  \
      }'
```

item.name: DEPRECATED. Adds additional subscriptions to a session

request.name: DEPRECATED. Adds additional subscriptions to a session

description.content:
**DEPRECATED:** see [Deprecation Notice](/GoToConnect/#tag/Real-time-Overview)
Adds additional `subscriptions` to the session with session ID `sessionId`.  This operation allows you to specify
one or more `subscriptions` at once. The real time API defines a `subscription` in terms of a subscription type, a
resource type, a resource type specific ID, and your organization ID. In this example, you create a
`subscription` with type `dialog`, a fancy way to say call state, to the resource of type `line.v2` with
ID `99be59bc-edfc-4c62-a73f-06087ec2fe00` under the organization with ID `f9d449ad-99b6-4105-985a-399cb1b29c41`.
The `subscription`'s ID is "elisha".

### Example Interaction with curl
```
 curl 'https://realtime.jive.com/v2/session/4m1egos8MCo3Ia46nJxWFaLOz4eKM6V3/subscriptions' -X POST -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
 -d '\
 [\
   {\
     "id":"elisha",\
     "type":"dialog",\
     "entity": {\
       "id":"99be59bc-edfc-4c62-a73f-06087ec2fe00",\
       "type":"line.v2",\
       "account":"f9d449ad-99b6-4105-985a-399cb1b29c41"\
     }\
   }\
 ]'
```

As shown below, the returned response contains the requested subscription `id`s as field names with their
values being either `true` or `false` depending on whether or not the `subscription` was successful. If the
request contained multiple `subscription`s, the response contains a key value pair for each requested `subscription`.
Some possible reasons for a `false` response might be that you aren't authorized to subscribe to the particular
resource or you tried to subscribe to the same resource more than once within the same `session`.
```
{
  "elisha": true
}
```
*Note:* when using a Notification Channel sometimes you will get a response code `202 Accepted` without response body. This means that Realtime API couldn't process your request immediately, but your subscriptions will be created in a short while, typically within a few seconds. You can check your subscriptions by querying your session.

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the session to add the requested `subscriptions` to

response.name: Realtime API received your subscription request, and they will be processed soon.

The requested subscription ids as field names with their values being either `true` or `false` depending on
whether or not the `subscription` was successful. If the request contained multiple subscriptions, the
response contains a key value pair for each requested `subscription`. Some possible reasons for a `false`
response might be that you are authorized to subscribe to the particular resource or you tried to subscribe
to the same resource more than once within the same `session`.

description.content:
Returns the call history for user of the access token, or the requested user if specified.
The `accountKey` is required in all cases to specify which account to request from.
Requesting the history of another user requires super admin permissions.

When requesting the history of another user, the response will include the fields `userKey`
and `accountKey` identifying that user.

The `extension` parameter can be used to filter results to one or more extensions. If
absent, the history of all the user's extensions is returned.

This should be only used for initial pulling.
Use a subscription instead if real-time history updates are needed.

Unanswered calls can be identified by their absent `answerTime`.

### Authentication Scopes

`cr.v1.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.


### Examples of interaction with curl

Call History Details

```
curl -XGET 'https://api.goto.com/call-history/v1/calls?startTime=2018-10-08T00%3A00%3A00&endTime=2018-10-14T23%3A59%3A59'  \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}'
```

### How pagination works

To start a query, first call this endpoint without a `pageMarker` and optionally set the
`pageSize` to the number of items you want per page (for example, `10`).
The presence of `nextPageMarker` in a response indicates that more results are available to
be fetched. To obtain further pages, send a new request with the `pageMarker` parameter set
to the value of `nextPageMarker`.

Once you reach the end of the result set, no results will be returned.

description.content:
Create a call history subscription for the specified account of the specified users.
If no user key is specified, the currently logged-in user is used.
The `accountKey` is required in all cases to specify which account to request from.
The endpoint responds with 409 when a duplicate subscription would be created with the same `channelId`, `accountKey` and `userKey`.
If no `extensions` parameter is specified, all the user's extensions will be monitored.
It is not allowed to filter by extensions when multiple `userKey` are specified.

**Creating a new subscription, differing only by the extensions, will conflict.
You must delete the old subscription first.**

When requesting the history of another user(s), the notification will include the fields
`userKeys` and `accountKey` identifying that/those user(s).

This operation activates notifications towards the provided Notification Service's channel.
The call history events pushed through the Notification Service follow the `CallHistoryEvent` model below.
A common usage pattern is to request a subscription and then fetch the whole history using the historical API described above.

A limit of 500 subscriptions is applied per user, per channel.

### Authentication Scopes

`call-history.v1.notifications.manage` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

### Example Interaction with curl

Subscribe to own history

```
curl -X POST "https://api.goto.com/call-history/v1/subscriptions" \
-d '{
  "accountKey": "12345678",
  "channelId": "oyYDKKFf4IE3J2PXB32AAeqWIqHaDxuTvTD7sabt2-AeYw_ce431afe-245e-4838-90f2-e926fd51abf0"
}' \
-H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"
```

```
{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": "12ed21de-9be4-4ca7-85d2-0f2356cacc83",
      "userKey": "4321",
      "channelId": "oyYDKKFf4IE3J2PXB32AAeqWIqHaDxuTvTD7sabt2-AeYw_ce431afe-245e-4838-90f2-e926fd51abf0",
      "accountKey": "12345678"
    }
  ]
}
```

Subscribe to the history of other users

```
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST \
-d '{"accountKey": "12345678", "userKeys": ["1234", "5678"], "channelId": "oyYDKKFf4IE3J2PXB32AAeqWIqHaDxuTvTD7sabt2-AeYw_ce431afe-245e-4838-90f2-e926fd51abf0"}' \
https://api.goto.com/call-history/v1/subscriptions
```

```
{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": "12ed21de-9be4-4ca7-85d2-0f2356cacc83",
      "userKey": "1234",
      "channelId": "oyYDKKFf4IE3J2PXB32AAeqWIqHaDxuTvTD7sabt2-AeYw_ce431afe-245e-4838-90f2-e926fd51abf0",
      "accountKey": "12345678"
    },
    {
      "id": "5a3845c5-1401-440d-a6af-20d7f38496bb",
      "userKey": "5678",
      "channelId": "oyYDKKFf4IE3J2PXB32AAeqWIqHaDxuTvTD7sabt2-AeYw_ce431afe-245e-4838-90f2-e926fd51abf0",
      "accountKey": "12345678"
    }
  ]
}
```

Subscribe to the history of specific extensions of another user

```
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST \
-d '{"accountKey": "12345678", "userKeys": ["1234"], "extensions": ["1002", "1003"], "channelId": "oyYDKKFf4IE3J2PXB32AAeqWIqHaDxuTvTD7sabt2-AeYw_ce431afe-245e-4838-90f2-e926fd51abf0"}' \
https://api.goto.com/call-history/v1/subscriptions
```
```
{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": "12ed21de-9be4-4ca7-85d2-0f2356cacc83",
      "userKey": "1234",
      "channelId": "oyYDKKFf4IE3J2PXB32AAeqWIqHaDxuTvTD7sabt2-AeYw_ce431afe-245e-4838-90f2-e926fd51abf0",
      "accountKey": "12345678",
      "extensions": ["1002", "1003"]
    }
  ]
}
```

description.content:
Update a previously created subscription, identified by its `subscriptionId`.
If the `userKey` parameter is missing, it is infered as the currently logged-in user. If no `extensions` parameter is specified, all the user's extensions will be monitored. Refer to the POST endpoint described above for more details.
For symmetry with the POST API, this endpoint accepts a body of type `CallHistorySubscription`, but the `id` and `channelId` can be omitted since they are already associated with the `subscriptionId` query parameter.
Note that it's currently not possible to modify the `channelId` or `id` of an active subscription. If provided, they must match their previous values. If you wish to change your `channelId`, you will need to delete and recreate your subscription.

### Authentication Scopes
`call-history.v1.notifications.manage` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
``` payload=$(cat <<EOF {
  "accountKey": "12345678",
  "extensions": ["1003"],
  "userKey": "4321"
} EOF ) curl -H "Content-type: application/json" -H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}" -X PUT -d "$payload" https://api.goto.com/call-history/v1/subscriptions/{SUBSCRIPTION_ID} ```

item.name: Transfers a call leg to a new destination

request.name: Transfers a call leg to a new destination

description.content:
This endpoint allows a user to do a blind transfer of a call leg to a new specified destination. The 2nd call leg that was bridged to the transferred leg will then be  terminated after the transfer completes.
In the case that the destination does not exist, the transferred call leg will be notified and be terminated.
### Scenario example
For example, let's say Alice (A) calls Bob (B) and Bob then transfers Alice to Carol's (C)  extension. After the transfer, Bob's call leg (Call-Leg2) will be terminated and the conversation will continue between Alice and Carol.
Conversation before the transfer:
`A <--Call-Leg1--> GoTo Platform <--Call-Leg2--> B`
Conversation after the transfer:
`A <--Call-Leg1--> GoTo Platform <--Call-Leg3--> C`
### Blind transfer call example

 ```

curl -XPOST 'https://api.goto.com/call-control/v1/call-legs/4f0ca058-1b1b-4e3c-908e-22a18f61dbd9-1565958399.2/blind-transfer' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "accountKey": "2930718022414574861",
    "destination" : {
      "type" : "DIAL_STRING",
      "dialString" : "2000"
    }
  }'

```

variable.description: (Required) Call leg identifier for the call leg used to perform the operation

response.name: The blind transfer command has been sent to the specified call leg.

description.content:
This endpoint allows a user hang up (terminate) an ongoing call leg specified by the provided  call leg identifier. For a conversation that had 2 call legs bridged together, terminating a call leg will  also terminate the other call leg to end the conversation.
  
### Scenario Example:
  
A conversation between 2 participants:
  
`A <--Call-Leg1--> GoTo Platform <--Call-Leg2--> B`
  
If a hang up operation is done to terminate Call-Leg1, then Call-Leg2 will also get  terminated thus ending the conversation.
### Hangup call example
```
curl -XPOST 'https://api.goto.com/call-control/v1/call-legs/4f0ca058-1b1b-4e3c-908e-22a18f61dbd9-1565958399.2/hangup' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "accountKey": "2930718022414574861"
  }'

```

item.name: Retrieves the active calls of accounts and their latest event.

request.name: Retrieves the active calls of accounts and their latest event.

description.content:
Retrieves the active calls and their latest event for all the accounts provided.
The result is ordered by the creation time of the calls, the latest calls appearing first (not ordered by the timestamp
of their latest event!).

The maximum number of account keys accepted for a query is 20. The maximum value for the `pageSize` parameter is 100.

To retrieve every past events for a given call, use the `/conversation-spaces/{conversationSpaceId}/events` endpoint.

### Authentication Scopes

`call-events.v1.events.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

item.name: Retrieves the events associated to the call.

request.name: Retrieves the events associated to the call.

description.content:
Retrieves the events associated to the call. The `sequenceFrom` and `sequenceTo` query parameters are optional.

If both are missing, all the events in the call will be returned.

If `sequenceFrom` is provided and `sequenceTo` is missing, then all events with sequence number equal to or larger than `sequenceFrom`
are returned including the latest call event.

If `sequenceFrom` is missing and `sequenceTo` is provided, then all events with sequence number equal to or smaller than
`sequenceTo` are returned.

Both `sequenceFrom` and `sequenceTo` bounds are inclusive.

The maximum value for the `pageSize` parameter is 100.

Events of calls that are terminated will not be listed in this manner but will be provided through
the [Call Reports API](https://developer.goto.com/GoToConnect#tag/Call-Reports-Overview).


### Authentication Scopes

`call-events.v1.events.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

description.content:
Creates a fax to be sent with up to 50 recipients. A fax resource is created for every recipients. The response returns the list of created fax ids and their associated recipient.
### Authentication Scopes
`fax.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl "https://api.goto.com/fax/v1/faxes \
  -XPOST \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}' \
  -H 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data' \
  -F metadata='{"virtualFaxMachineId": "a8bf7c0e-9f5f-4fe2-8725-9955ae051c76", "recipients": ["+14449998888"], "scheduleFaxAt": "2019-12-31T23:59:59.999999Z"}';type=application/json \
  -F 'file=@myfile.pdf;type=application/pdf;filename=myfile.pdf'
  -F 'file=@myfile2.pdf;type=application/pdf;filename=myfile2.pdf'

```

formdata.description: (Required) The metadata used to send a fax like the recipients of the fax and the virtual fax machine to use to send it.
(Required) Files to be sent in the fax. The following formats are supported. (.pdf, .rtf, .txt, .jpg, .png, .tiff, .bmp, .gif, .doc, .docx, .ppt, .pptx, .xls, .xlsx).

Get a download URL to a Fax's PDF or its first page as PNG preview image. The URL has a default (and maximum) time to live of 600000 milliseconds (10 minutes).
### Authentication Scopes
`fax.v1.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl "https://api.goto.com/fax/v1/faxes/5097f252-b5f7-45d0-9589-4eb5057e764d?fileType=pdf" \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

description.content:
### Authentication Scopes
`fax.v1.notifications.manage` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Description
Create a subscription for the authenticated user. A notification channel must have previously been created  using the [Notification Channel API](/GoToConnect#tag/Notification-Channel-Overview). A subscription will be created for every virtual fax machines the authenticated user has access too. If the user does not have permissions for any virtual fax machines, 403 will be returned. See [this](/GoToConnect#tag/Channels).

The subscription allows notifications to be sent to the notification channel with the provided notification channel ID. Only one subscription per virtual fax machine can exist at a time for a given user's channel ID. If the subscription already exists, the existing one will be returned in the response.

description.content:
Get total count of unread messages across all conversations for this phone number.


### Authentication Scopes

`messaging.v1.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.


### Example Interaction with curl

```
curl "https://api.goto.com/messaging/v1/conversations-summary/{ownerPhoneNumber}" \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

query.description:
The key of the user on behalf of which this request is being made.
To be used by user with super admin privileges. Requests made for the user of the
bearer token don't require this parameter.

variable.description: (Required) The user's phone number, which is an E164-formatted phone number, used for sending and receiving messages. The given user in the authentication token must be allowed to monitor this phone number.

response.name: Summary for all conversations.
A non E164-formatted phone number was provided. The `BAD_REQUEST` error code will be returned in such case.

* `AUTHN_INVALID_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is not valid.
* `AUTHN_EXPIRED_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is expired.
* `AUTHN_MALFORMED_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is malformed.
* `AUTHN_UNSUPPORTED_SCHEME` - The supplied authentication scheme is unsupported.

- `AUTHZ_INSUFFICIENT_SCOPE` - The scopes granted to the supplied token are insufficient to perform the requested action or the request supplied no token.

* `AUTHN_UNKOWN` - An unknown error occurred.

description.content:
Obtains a paginated list of conversations in which this user's phone
number has sent or received messages, sorted by most recent conversations first.

The data contained in the response can be used to assess whether further
synchronization of data needs to be performed for any conversations. As
an example, if the `lastMessageId` does not match the last known message
for a conversation, then a `GET` `/messages` should be performed.


### Authentication Scopes

`messaging.v1.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.


### Example Interaction with curl

```
curl "https://api.goto.com/messaging/v1/conversations?ownerPhoneNumber={ownerPhoneNumber}&contactPhoneNumber={contactPhoneNumber}" \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

query.description: (Required) The user's phone number, which is an E164-formatted phone number, for sending and receiving messages. The given user in the authentication token must be allowed to monitor this phone number.
Each contact's phone number is an E164-formatted phone number. If provided, filters the results to only contain the conversation between the provided owner and the specified contacts.
Newest ISO-8601 formatted timestamp of the queried time range. For example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z. This field is set with current timestamp by default.
The returned `nextPageMarker` from a paginated collection is used here to fetch the starting item for the paginated result.
The maximum number of items returned in a page.
Filters the list of conversations to only include those that contain one or more unread messages

The key of the user on behalf of which this request is being made.
To be used by user with super admin privileges. Requests made for the user of the
bearer token don't require this parameter.

description.content:
Sends a new message to up to 10 contacts from a given phone number.

There is a limit on outbound SMS per month per organization. The following error code: TOO_MANY_REQUESTS
will be returned in this case. Reach out to support if this limit must be increased.

### Authentication Scopes

`messaging.v1.send` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

### Example Interaction with curl

```
curl -X "POST" "https://api.goto.com/messaging/v1/messages" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"ownerPhoneNumber": "{ownerPhoneNumber}", "contactPhoneNumbers": [ "{contactPhoneNumber}" ], "body": "{message}"}' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

For sending a new message with attached media files a `multipart/form-data` request is used.
Note: it is possible to send a message with no media files with a `multipart/form-data`
request as long as it has message body to it.

Example:

```
curl -J -X POST 'https://api.goto.com/messaging/v1/messages' \
  -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {token}" \
  -F "ownerPhoneNumber={ownerPhoneNumber};type=text/plain" \
  -F "contactPhoneNumbers={contactPhoneNumber};type=text/plain" \
  -F "body=\"{message}\";type=text/plain" \
  -F "media=@file1.jpg;type=image/jpeg" \
  -F "media=@file2.jpg;type=image/jpeg"
```

(Required) Each contact's phone number is an E164-formatted phone number.
The message body (optional if the message has at least one media file attached).
The key of the user on behalf of which this request is being made. For use by user with SuperAdmin privileges. Requests made for the user of the bearer token don't require this parameter.

The media you want to send (optional if the body is not empty). Any typical mime type listed
[here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types/Common_types) will be supported as the `type` parameter.

description.content:
Obtains a paginated list of media metadata in a conversation between the
user's phone number and the specified contact's phone number, sorted
by most recent media first. A time range can be specified to limit the result set.

### Example Interaction with curl

```
curl "https://api.goto.com/messaging/v1/media-metadata?ownerPhoneNumber={ownerPhoneNumber}&contactPhoneNumber={contactPhoneNumber}" \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

query.description: (Required) The user's phone number, which is an E164-formatted phone number, for sending and receiving messages. The given user in the authentication token must be allowed to monitor this phone number.

(Required) The contact's phone number which is an E164-formatted phone number. This is the other phone number that is sending messages to or receiving messages from the owner's phone number. If a list of `contactPhoneNumber`, the endpoint will find the conversation matching the full list.
Newest ISO-8601 formatted timestamp of the queried time range. For example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z. This field is set with current timestamp by default.

Restrict the media type(s) included in the result set. Use of the wildcard character
are permitted. For example, `image/*` or `*/*`. Media types must be RFC 2046 compliant.
The returned `nextPageMarker` from a paginated collection is used here to fetch the starting item for the paginated result.
The maximum number of items returned in a page.

The key of the user on behalf of which this request is being made.
To be used by user with super admin privileges. Requests made for the user of the
bearer token don't require this parameter.

response.name: List of paginated Media Metadata

The `BAD_REQUEST` error code will be returned in the following cases:
  - A non E164-formatted phone number was provided
  - the owner phone number is missing
  - the contact phone numbers list is empty
  - an invalid timestamp was provided
  - the `pageMarker` format is invalid
  - the `pageSize` format is invalid
  - the `contentType` value is invalid.

There was an error during authentication.  The API returns a number of `errorCode` values in
the response that provide additional details.

item.name: Create a subscription to get notified of presence changes for the specified user(s).

request.name: Create a subscription to get notified of presence changes for the specified user(s).

description.content:
Create one or many presence subscription(s) for the specified user(s).

This operation activates push notifications towards the provided Notification Service's channel.

The presence updates pushed through the Notification service follow the `PresenceNotification` model below.

This operation creates a subscription and returns a `subscriptionId` in the response body for each specified `userKey`/`channelId` pair. The request will fail if one of the specified `userKey`/`channelId` pair is already created.

The service will report an `UNAVAILABLE` appearance for the presence of an `userKey` which does not exist.

The authorization token identifies the calling user and is used to verify if he/she is authorized to request presence from the specified `userKey`s. Users may only request presence for `userKey`s belonging in an organization they belong to. This authorization process will not only take place at the initial subscription but also continously while the subscription(s) are active. When subscriptions fail on the authorization criteria, the service will report an `UNAVAILABLE` appearance as the presence of the corresponding `userKey`s.

For each subscription, it is guaranteed that at least one `PresenceNotification` will be sent shortly through the specified channel after this endpoint is called.

The service may send presence events at any time on the notification channel which do not necessarily contain actual presence change, i.e. duplicate presence events.

Up to 500 concurrent subscriptions can be created per `channelId`, in a single or multiple smaller requests.

### Example
```
curl 'https://api.goto.com/presence/v1/subscriptions' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d ' \
{ \
  "channelId": "2856d8d4-173d-4852-81d4-c0651af1dcb0", \
  "userKeys": ["123456123456", "456789456789"] \
}'
```
Response:
```json
{
  "items": [
    {
      "channelId": "2856d8d4-173d-4852-81d4-c0651af1dcb0",
      "userKey": "123456123456",
      "subscriptionId": "Mjg1NmQ4ZDQtMTczZC00ODUyLTgxZDQtYzA2NTFhZjFkY2IwLTEyMzQ1NjEyMzQ1Ng=="
    },
    {
      "channelId": "2856d8d4-173d-4852-81d4-c0651af1dcb0",
      "userKey": "456789456789",
      "subscriptionId": "Mjg1NmQ4ZDQtMTczZC00ODUyLTgxZDQtYzA2NTFhZjFkY2IwLTQ1Njc4OTQ1Njc4OQ=="
    }
  ]
}
```
Events in the notification channel:
```json
{
  "source": "presence",
  "type": "presence",
  "timestamp": "2019-07-25T17:32:28.444Z",
  "content": {
    "userKey": "123456123456",
    "timestamp": "2019-07-25T17:31:06.555Z",
    "appearance": "ONLINE",
    "userAgents": [
      {
        "name": "GoToConnect",
        "family": "WEB"
      }
    ],
    "userNote": "Working from home"
  }
}
{
  "source": "presence",
  "type": "presence",
  "timestamp": "2019-07-25T17:32:28.444Z",
  "content": {
    "userKey": "456789456789",
    "timestamp": "2019-07-25T17:32:28.441Z",
    "appearance": "UNAVAILABLE"
  }
}
```

### Authentication Scopes
- `presence.v1.notifications.manage` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

item.name: Get the presence of the specified user(s)

request.name: Get the presence of the specified user(s)

description.content:
Obtains the presence of the specified user(s).

For any long-running client the /subscriptions endpoint should be preferred.

The service responds with a presence item for each `userKey` specified in the request.

The service will return an `UNAVAILABLE` appearance for presence of `userKey`s which do not exist.

The authorization token identifies the calling user and is used to verify if he/she is authorized to request presence from the specified `userKey`s. Users may only request presence for `userKey`s belonging in an organization they belong to. When subscriptions fail on the authorization criteria, the service will return an `UNAVAILABLE` appearance as the presence of the corresponding `userKey`s.

There is a limit of 100 `userKey`s per request.
For technical reasons the server may temporarily fail to process the request and would then respond with a 503 status. The client may retry the request as soon as it wants.

### Example
Request for `userKey`s 123456123456, 456789456789 and 12345:
```
curl 'https://api.goto.com/presence/v1/presence?userKey=123456123456&userKey=456789456789&userKey=12345' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'
```
Response:
```json
{
  "items": [
    {
      "userKey": "123456123456",
      "timestamp": "2019-07-25T17:31:06.555Z",
      "appearance": "ONLINE",
      "userAgents": [
        {
          "name": "GoToConnect",
          "family": "DESKTOP"
        }
      ],
      "userNote": "Working from home"
    },
    {
      "userKey": "456789456789",
      "timestamp": "2019-07-25T17:33:56.646Z",
      "appearance": "UNAVAILABLE"
    },
    {
      "userKey": "12345",
      "timestamp": "2019-07-25T17:33:56.646Z",
      "appearance": "UNAVAILABLE"
    }
  ]
}
```

### Authentication Scopes
- `presence.v1.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

item.name: Set presence fields for a user

request.name: Set presence fields for a user

description.content:
Set presence fields for a user which will be aggregated into its final presence status to be broadcasted to subscribed users.

This endpoint uses the [JSON Merge Patch](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7386) style of patching. Fields cannot be removed by using a `null` value and they can be reset as explained below.

Since the service behind this API doesn't know when the client posting to this endpoint becomes offline, the lifetime of the user presence must be handled through this endpoint. Specifically, when the service has previously received a `userStatus` of `IN_A_MEETING` and the status wasn't posted again for 60 seconds, it is assumed that the client has gone offline and that it is no longer in the meeting (and thus this status is reset). To keep your `IN_A_MEETING` status active, it must be sent continuously before it expires. A refresh period of about 50 seconds is recommended to protect yourself from unexpected latencies.

Absent fields do not reset values. As such, if `userAppearance`, `userDoNotDisturb`, `userDoNotDisturbExpiration`, `userStatus` or `userNote` are omitted, they are considered as if they were set to their respective previous values. In order to reset an appearance or meeting status, the fields must be explicitly set to `NONE`. To reset the `userNote` field, it must be set to `""` (empty string). To reset the `userDoNotDisturbExpiration` field, reset the `userDoNotDisturb` field.

The presence service persists the `userAppearance`, `userDoNotDisturb`, `userStatus` and `userNote` fields and aggregates them into presence notification/responses even though the client which set them is offline.

In addition to the `/user-presence` endpoint, clients may also read their own user presence fields through the `/presence` endpoint or by subscribing to their own `userKey`. Only in these particular cases will the `userAppearance`, `userDoNotDisturb` and `userStatus` fields be available in the `Presence` object.
When setting the `userDoNotDisturbExpiration` field with a valid ISO 8601 timestamp, the `userDoNotDisturb` field must also be set to `DO_NOT_DISTURB`. The `userDoNotDisturb` field will then keep that state until the timestamp is reached, at which point the `userDoNotDisturb` will expire and be reset to `NONE`. An expired `userDoNotDisturbExpiration` timestamp will be omitted from the response. A `userDoNotDisturbExpiration` timestamp in the past will be rejected.
The modified user's presence defaults to the owner of the authentication token and can otherwise be specified with the `userKey` parameter. Modifying another user's presence requires super admin permissions and modifications are limited to DoNotDisturb
### Example #1
```
curl -XPATCH 'https://api.goto.com/presence/v1/user-presence' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{ "userStatus": "IN_A_MEETING" }'
```
Response:
```json
{
  "userAppearance": "NONE",
  "userDoNotDisturb": "NONE",
  "userStatus": "IN_A_MEETING",
  "userNote": "Live, laugh, love"
}
```

### Example #2
```
curl -XPATCH 'https://api.goto.com/presence/v1/user-presence' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{ \
    "userStatus": "NONE", \
    "userNote": "" \
  }'
```
Response:
```json
{
  "userAppearance": "NONE",
  "userDoNotDisturb": "NONE",
  "userStatus": "NONE",
  "userNote": ""
}
```
### Example #3
```
curl -XPATCH 'https://api.goto.com/presence/v1/user-presence' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{ \
    "userDoNotDisturb": "DO_NOT_DISTURB", \
    "userDoNotDisturbExpiration": "2029-11-30T01:17:23Z" \
  }'
```
Response:
```json
{
  "userAppearance": "NONE",
  "userDoNotDisturb": "DO_NOT_DISTURB",
  "userDoNotDisturbExpiration": "2029-11-30T01:17:23Z",
  "userStatus": "NONE",
  "userNote": ""
}
```
### Example #4 (modifying another user's user presence)
```
curl -XPATCH 'https://api.goto.com/presence/v1/user-presence?userKey={COLLEAGUE_USER_KEY}' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {SUPER_ADMIN_ACCESS_TOKEN}' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{ \
    "userDoNotDisturb": "DO_NOT_DISTURB", \
    "userDoNotDisturbExpiration": "2029-11-30T01:17:23Z" \
  }'
```
Response:
```json
{
  "userDoNotDisturb": "DO_NOT_DISTURB",
  "userDoNotDisturbExpiration": "2029-11-30T01:17:23Z",
}
```

description.content:
Creates a new notification channel for the authenticated user (e.g. the user in the given access token). If the channel type is not specified, a WebSocket channel will be created.
The maximum number of open WebSocket allowed for a given user is 50. Once this threshold is exceeded, creating a new WebSocket channel will fail with a 409 response. It is critical for applications to teardown un-needed WebSocket channels. A maximum of 1 Webhook channel can be created per Webhook  URL for the tuple Webhook URL, userKey and oauthClientId, if a second one is created it will  update the existing one with the new information.
### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl -XPOST 'https://api.goto.com/notification-channel/v1/channels/my-channel-nickname'          \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}'                \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'                      \
  -d '{"channelType": "Webhook", "webhookChannelData": {"webhook": {"url": "https://my.company.com/webhook"}}}'

```

item.name: Retrieves a content token used to access the requested recording

request.name: Retrieves a content token used to access the requested recording

description.content:
Generates a short-lived content token used to create a download link to the content.  This content token
serves as a component to a URL designed to allow a browser's native download capabilities to handle the
file download and must be treated as a such.  It should not be shared indiscriminently.  The returned
information contains the expiration date for the returned token.  Tokens should not be used after their
expiration date.

### Retrieving Content Tokens and Recording status
This API does not generate content tokens for recordings that have not reached the `UPLOADED` status.
Calling this endpoint for a recording with a status other than `UPLOADED` results in a `400` response.

### Security
The API only allows access to recordings for organizations associated to the requesting principal and for
which this API has been enabled.

### Authentication Scopes
`recording.v1.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

response.name: The content token used to generate a download link

description.content:
Creates a new session for an extension to be able to send and receive calls as well as receive notifications. If a session already exists for the given user, organization, and extension, the existing session will be updated with the information provided in the request.
### Authentication Scopes
`webrtc.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl -X "POST" "https://webrtc.jive.com/web-calls/v1/sessions" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "organizationId": "01234567-aaaa-0123-bbbb-000000000001",
    "extensionNumber": "1121",
    "clientInformation": {
      "appId": "my-application-name",
      "appVersion": "2.3.1",
      "platform": "INTEGRATOR"
      },
    "callbackReference": {
      "incomingCallChannelId": "0Nda6GSizLlSPskQkKvY5n0rrgND5X5uyPUfzT_FHuwx1p0umr-JNtVuFDZXHhOrh5SIopdBiNov0hcPi-JkDdg",
      "sessionManagementChannelId": "0Nda6GSizLlSPskQkKvY5n0rrgND5X5uyPUfzT_FHuwx1p0umr-JNtVuFDZXHhOrh5SIopdBiNov0hcPi-JkDdg"
    }
  }' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'

```

description.content:
Remove the session and all related calls
### Authentication Scopes
`webrtc.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl -X "DELETE" "https://webrtc.jive.com/web-calls/v1/sessions/0iO2GMahypu5trGOzcfGlGQZLKpUWC2lxvgSLCd" \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

description.content:
Retrieve the state of the session including all ongoing calls. Note that the /sessions/{sessionId}/calls endpoint should be used if call states need to be polled periodically.
### Authentication Scopes
`webrtc.v1.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl -X "GET" "https://webrtc.jive.com/web-calls/v1/sessions/0iO2GMahypu5trGOzcfGlGQZLKpUWC2lxvgSLCd" \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

description.content:
Creates a new outgoing call towards the recipient provided using the local SDP offer.
### Authentication Scopes
`webrtc.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl -X "POST" "https://webrtc.jive.com/web-calls/v1/sessions/0iO2GMahypu5trGOzcfGlGQZLKpUWC2lxvgSLCd/calls" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "dialString": "+15559998888",
    "sdp": "v=0
o=rtcweb 1 1 IN IP4 199.88.123.123
s=-
t=0 0
a=ice-lite
a=group:BUNDLE audio
a=msid-semantic: WMS ANAUOoBPqN08BQw7SeGk3EhjiTBWNaDXu47M
m=audio 40342 UDP/TLS/RTP/SAVPF 111 126
c=IN IP4 199.88.123.123
a=ice-ufrag:YoPy
a=ice-pwd:gv3wCs/e+Rn5YKunE/J7tRi7
a=fingerprint:sha-256 F5:F5:F5:F5:F5:F5:F5:F5:F5:F5:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1:A1
a=rtcp:9 IN IP4 0.0.0.0
a=setup:passive
a=sendrecv
a=rtcp-mux
a=rtpmap:111 opus/48000/2
a=rtpmap:126 telephone-event/8000
a=maxptime:60
a=candidate:0 1 UDP 2113667327 199.88.123.123 40342 typ host
a=end-of-candidates
",
    "inCallChannelId": "0Nda6GSizLlSPskQkKvY5n0rrgND5X5uyPUfzT_FHuwx1p0umr-JNtVuFDZXHhOrh5SIopdBiNov0hcPi-JkDdg"
  }' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

  resource type and requested action. This response provides no indication of the existence
  of the specific resource targeted by the request.

description.content:
It retrieves the current information and state of the call.
### Authentication Scopes
`webrtc.v1.read` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl -X "GET" "https://webrtc.jive.com/web-calls/v1/sessions/0iO2GMahypu5trGOzcfGlGQZLKpUWC2lxvgSLCd/calls/1b94f3561664ab3425318e3f69de3634" \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

variable.description: (Required) Session ID issued when the device session was created.
(Required) Call ID issued when the call was created or invite received.

  perform the specified action on the targeted resource and has the ability to read (GET)
  the targeted resource.

description.content:
The call is ended and the media will be terminated.
### Authentication Scopes
`webrtc.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl -X "DELETE" "https://webrtc.jive.com/web-calls/v1/sessions/0iO2GMahypu5trGOzcfGlGQZLKpUWC2lxvgSLCd/calls/1b94f3561664ab3425318e3f69de3634" \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

description.content:
The ringing request must be sent when a new incoming call is received by the client and the user notified by visual or audio feedback.
### Authentication Scopes
`webrtc.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl -X "POST" "https://webrtc.jive.com/web-calls/v1/sessions/0iO2GMahypu5trGOzcfGlGQZLKpUWC2lxvgSLCd/calls/1b94f3561664ab3425318e3f69de3634/ringing" \
  -d '{
    "inCallChannelId": "0Nda6GSizLlSPskQkKvY5n0rrgND5X5uyPUfzT_FHuwx1p0umr-JNtVuFDZXHhOrh5SIopdBiNov0hcPi-JkDdg"
  }' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

variable.description: (Required) Session ID issued when the device session was created.

description.content:
When a network change occurs during a call, or call media changes, this will re-establish the RTP stream and signalling connection. An SDP is sent in the request body, and an updated SDP is received in response from the server.
### Authentication Scopes
`webrtc.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

variable.description: (Required) Session ID issued when the device session was created.
(Required) Call ID issued when the call was created or invite received.

response.name: Successfully sent a new offer. The call has updated its media or connection attributes. The updated SDP is returned in the call.

description.content:
The DTMF is sent out to the remote side. You must wait for a response before sending another DTMF to guarantee the order in which the DTMF signals are sent.
### Authentication Scopes
`webrtc.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

variable.description: (Required) Session ID issued when the device session was created.
(Required) Call ID issued when the call was created or invite received.

response.name: Successfully sends a DTMF tone on the call for the remote side.

The request has one or more issues.  The API returns a number of `errorCode` values in the response that provide additional details.  The response may contain one ore more values in `constraintViolations` to provide additional details useful in debugging.
* BAD_REQUEST - The request is not valid.
* MALFORMED_REQUEST - The request is malformed and not interpretable.

There was an error during authentication.  The API returns a number of `errorCode` values in
the response that provide additional details.

* `AUTHN_INVALID_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is not valid.
* `AUTHN_EXPIRED_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is expired.
* `AUTHN_MALFORMED_TOKEN` - The supplied authentication token is malformed.
* `AUTHN_UNSUPPORTED_SCHEME` - The supplied authentication scheme is unsupported.

There was an error during authorization.  The API returns a number of `errorCode` values in the response that provide additional details.

* `UNAUTHORIZED` - The principal represented by the supplied token is not authorized to
  perform the specified action on the targeted resource and has the ability to read (GET)
  the targeted resource.
* `AUTHZ_INSUFFICIENT_SCOPE` - The supplied token lacks sufficient scopes to perform the
  requested action on the requested resource type or the request supplied no token.
  Enforcement of scopes occurs before other authorization decisions and is based solely on the
  resource type and requested action. This response provides no indication of the existence
  of the specific resource targeted by the request.
The specified resource does not exist or the requesting principal does not have the ability to read or modify the specified resource.  A `NOT_FOUND` `errorCode` accompanies this response.
The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the target resource.
Your request was denied because you have reached some request limit for this API. Try again later.

An unknown error occurred. The API returns a number of `errorCode` values in the response that provide additional details.
* `UNKNOWN_ERROR` - An unknown error occurred.

There was an issue routing the request.  A `UNAVAILABLE`
`errorCode` accompanies this response.

description.content:
A call will be merged with the selected second call.  From that point, the audio from the second call will be combined with the first call and sent along the first call RTP to the client.  Client audio from the first call will be sent to both destinations. If the referId is not found, a 400 bad request will be returned.
### Authentication Scopes
`webrtc.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.
### Example Interaction with curl
```
curl -X "POST" "https://webrtc.jive.com/web-calls/v1/sessions/0iO2GMahypu5trGOzcfGlGQZLKpUWC2lxvgSLCd/calls/1b94f3561664ab3425318e3f69de3634/merge" \ -d '{
    "referId": "4f33a3561664ab3425318e3f69jw9678"
  }' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'
```

`webrtc.v1.write` must be used when a token is requested from the Authentication API.

description.content:
The call is ended and the media will be terminated. A reason may be provided to
indicate why the call is being hung up.

query.description:
Reason for the hangup action on a call.
UNKNOWN - Default value. The reason for the call being hung up is not specified.
USER_ACTION - The user hung up the call.
IDLE_MEDIA - The call is hung up because there is no media received or sent.
DISCONNECTED - The network was disconnected causing the call to be hung up.

variable.description: (Required) Call ID issued when the call was created or invite received.

description.content:
When a network change occurs during a call, or call media changes, this
will re-establish the RTP stream and signalling connection. An SDP is
sent in the request body, and an updated SDP is received in response
from the server.

variable.description: (Required) Call ID issued when the call was created or invite received.

response.name: Successfully sent a new offer. The call has updated its media or connection attributes. The updated SDP is returned in the Call.

description.content:
A warm transfer is to connect two ongoing call together. After the
transfer, the current user is no longer in any of the two calls and both
remote peer from each calls are now connected together. If the referId is not
found, a 400 bad request will be returned.

variable.description: (Required) Call ID issued when the call was created or invite received.

response.name: Successfully warm transferred the calls provided. The status of the calls is ended and the calls must be considered terminated by the client and associated resources may be released.

description.content:
Create one device using the supplied client information and notification channel IDs in callback reference. Upon successful registration, the device will be available for registering extensions using the supplied `deviceId`.

If the channel IDs are invalid, a `HTTP 400 Bad Request` response will be returned.

If a device is already registered for the given `deviceId`, a `HTTP 409 Conflict` response will be returned.

item.name: Create extensions under a specific device.

request.name: Create extensions under a specific device.

description.content:
Creates one session for each specified extension number of a device to be able to send and receive calls as well as receive notifications. The session is created for a specific device identified by a `deviceId` and for an organization identified by an `organizationId` specified for each extension.

If the channel IDs are invalid, a `HTTP 400 Bad Request` response will be returned.

If no extension number or if more than 20 extension numbers are provided, a `HTTP 400 Bad Request` response will be returned.

variable.description: (Required) ID associated with the device hardware in case of a mobile or with a tab in case of a browser tab.

response.name: Successfully created extensions for the device.
